posts.post_content:
[Lightning Helix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Helix) becomes pretty cruel. For {R}{W}{U}{U} you deal 9 damage and gain 9 life.  
  
Even the standard humble [Lightning Bolt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Bolt) becomes pretty cruel with 9 damage for {R}{U}{U}.  
  
And that's just things with a low mana cost. Imagine if you have a shitload of mana... how about a kicked [Rite of Replication](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Replication)... replicated twice? Or 39 2/2 zombies with [Army of the Damned](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Army of the Damned)?
posts.html:
Lightning Helix becomes pretty cruel. For {R}{W}{U}{U} you deal 9 damage and gain 9 life.

posts.post_content:
@Demonic\_Angel13: No. Rebound does not make this card remotely cooler. Unless coolness is defined by keywords on cards.  
Straight out of the Comprehensive Rules:   
704.5e: "*If a copy of a spell is in a zone other than the stack, it ceases to exist*. If a copy of a card is in  
any zone other than the stack or the battlefield, it ceases to exist".
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
All of you guys keep going on about how good this card is but you have to put in nine mana into this card and then you have to pay two more mana to get it to copy twice.   
That's only if it gets that far. A simple [Boomerang](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boomerang) will screw this card so bad.
